00052 void Preprocessor::optimalThreshold (double threshold)
00053 {
00054     if ( threshold < 0.0 )
00055         optimalThreshold_ = 0.0;
00056     else
00057     {
00058         if ( threshold > 1.0 )
00059             optimalThreshold_ = 1.0;
00060         else
00061             optimalThreshold_ = threshold;
00062     }
00063 };

00084 void Preprocessor::backgroundReferenceGrayLevel (double grayLevel)
00085 {
00086     if ( grayLevel < 0.0 )
00087         backgroundReferenceGrayLevel_ = 0.0;
00088     else
00089     {
00090         if ( grayLevel > 1.0 )
00091             backgroundReferenceGrayLevel_ = 1.0;
00092         else
00093             backgroundReferenceGrayLevel_ = grayLevel;
00094     }
00095 };

00154 void Preprocessor::convertToGrayscale (Clip& clip)
00155 {
00156     if ( clip.colorspace() != COLORSPACE_GRAYSCALE )
00157         clip.colorspace(COLORSPACE_GRAYSCALE);
00158 };

00171 double Preprocessor::computeOptimalThreshold (Clip& clip)
00172 {
00173     // Implicit change of colorspace
00174     convertToGrayscale(clip);
00175     
00176     return 0.0;
00177 };

00193 double Preprocessor::findBackgroundReferenceGrayLevel (Clip& clip, unsigned int referenceGrayLevelNeighbours)
00194 {
00195     // Implicit change of colorspace
00196     convertToGrayscale(clip);
00197     
00198     
00199     // Compute image histogram
00200     vector<unsigned int> histogram(256, 0);
00201     
00202     for (unsigned int i=0; i < clip.height(); ++i)
00203     {
00204         for (unsigned int j=0; j < clip.width(); ++j)
00205         {
00206             // Get gray level of this pixel
00207             double grayLevel = clip.getPixel(i,j).grayLevel();
00208             
00209             // Update histogram
00210             histogram[floor(grayLevel * 255.0)] += 1;
00211         }
00212     }
00213     
00214     
00215     // Search the more frequent level of gray
00216     vector<unsigned int>::iterator histogramIterator;
00217     unsigned int moreFrequentGrayLevel = 0, levelCounter = 0;
00218     
00219     for (histogramIterator = histogram.begin(); histogramIterator != histogram.end(); ++histogramIterator, ++levelCounter)
00220     {
00221         if ( *histogramIterator > histogram[moreFrequentGrayLevel] )
00222             moreFrequentGrayLevel = levelCounter;
00223     }
00224     backgroundReferenceGrayLevel_ = moreFrequentGrayLevel * histogram[moreFrequentGrayLevel];
00225     
00226     
00227     // Search the neighbours of the more frequent level of gray
00228     vector<unsigned int>::reverse_iterator histogramReverseIterator( find (histogram.rbegin(), histogram.rend(), histogram[moreFrequentGrayLevel])++ );
00229     histogramIterator = histogramReverseIterator.base()++;
00230     double nFrequencies = histogram[moreFrequentGrayLevel];
00231     
00232     for ( unsigned int i = 1; i <= referenceGrayLevelNeighbours; ++i )
00233     {
00234         // Search forwards
00235         if ( histogramIterator != histogram.end() )
00236         {
00237             backgroundReferenceGrayLevel_ += (moreFrequentGrayLevel + i) * histogram[moreFrequentGrayLevel + i];
00238             ++histogramIterator;
00239             nFrequencies += histogram[moreFrequentGrayLevel + i];
00240         }
00241         
00242         // Search backwards
00243         if ( histogramReverseIterator != histogram.rend() )
00244         {
00245             backgroundReferenceGrayLevel_ += (moreFrequentGrayLevel - i) * histogram[moreFrequentGrayLevel - i];
00246             ++histogramReverseIterator;
00247             nFrequencies += histogram[moreFrequentGrayLevel - i];
00248         }
00249     }
00250     
00251     
00252     // Set the background reference gray level found
00253     backgroundReferenceGrayLevel_ = backgroundReferenceGrayLevel_ / nFrequencies;
00254     return backgroundReferenceGrayLevel_;
00255 };

00272 void Preprocessor::removeIsolatedNoise (Clip& clip, unsigned int noisyNeighbours)
00273 {
00274     // Implicit change of colorspace
00275     convertToGrayscale(clip);
00276     
00277     
00278     // Loop over the clip to remove every noisy isolated pixel
00279     for (unsigned int i=0; i < clip.height(); ++i)
00280     {
00281         for (unsigned int j=0; j < clip.width(); ++j)
00282         {
00283             Pixel pixel = clip.getPixel(i, j);
00284             
00285             // Discard background pixels
00286             if ( (pixel.grayLevel() > optimalThreshold_) && (backgroundReferenceGrayLevel_ > optimalThreshold_) )
00287                 continue;
00288             
00289             if ( (pixel.grayLevel() < optimalThreshold_) && (backgroundReferenceGrayLevel_ < optimalThreshold_) )
00290                 continue;
00291     
00292                 
00293             // Examine the pixel neighbourhood
00294             unsigned int nPixels = 0;
00295             
00296             for(int p = i-1; p < (signed int)i+2; p++)
00297             {
00298                 for(int q = j-1; q < (signed int)j+2; q++)
00299                 {
00300                     // Check clip borders
00301                     if ( (p < 0 || p >= (signed int)clip.width()) || (q < 0 || q >= (signed int)clip.height()) )
00302                         continue;
00303                     else
00304                         nPixels++;
00305                     
00306                     // Get neighbour pixel gray level
00307                     Pixel neighbourPixel = clip.getPixel(p, q);
00308                     
00309                     // Update the noisy pixel count
00310                     if (neighbourPixel.grayLevel() > optimalThreshold_)
00311                         ; //backgroundPixels += 1;
00312                 }
00313             }
00314         }
00315     }
00316     
00317 };
